stanza.line: The forward violet thus did I (a)chide(/a)
Sweet thief whence didst thou steal thy sweet that (b)smells(/b)
If not from my love's breath The purple (a)pride(/a)
Which on thy soft check for complexion (b)dwells(/b)
In my love's veins thou hast too grossly (c)dyed(/c)
The lily I condemned for thy (d)hand(/d)
And buds of marjoram had stol'n thy (c)hair(/c)
The roses fearfully on thorns did (d)stand(/d)
A third nor red nor white had stol'n of (f)both(/f)
And to his robbery had annexed thy (e)breath(/e)
But for his theft in pride of all his (f)growth(/f)
A vengeful canker eat him up to (g)death(/g)
More flowers I noted yet I none could (g)see(/g)
But sweet or colour it had stol'n from thee
